docs: Bargain Price for what you get. This place was remodeled, refurbished and redone the first of April, 2014 and it shows it. We had a great spacious room with a comfortable bed... all the whistles and bells (microwave, small fridge, coffee & large flat screen). If there is an area that needs attention it was the so-so breakfast. But that said, this Provo property is highly commended. </DOC> Visited the end of August for 3 nights. Had room 301 which was in the corner so it was extra big and away from the freeway noise(Wednesday was trash day so watch out for the early am noise). $89 per night was a great price which included breakfast. Staff was wonderful and helpful when our keys de-magnetized. Room was very clean and the beds were comfortable, feather pillows were great. Close to the Provo Town Center Mall and many restaurants. </DOC> At the end of a long day on the road, the Fairfield was convenient to access and had rooms available. For the rooms, some pluses (access, clean, good shower) and some minuses (stuffy, could not find a way to regulate heat). However, big negative for us was the noise from the other rooms.
summary: I stayed here and had a great time. My daughter had a great time. Also quiet. The price was very competitive and the pools were on a nice make sure you are between the ocastments. But. I chose the corner suite would be away.
